revised_title: Human Adaptability and Nutrition in Ethiopia: The Ethiopia Applied Nutrition Project
tldr: The Ethiopia Applied Nutrition Project aimed to improve the nutritional status and overall health of the people in Debarek, a highland area in Ethiopia. By comparing the results from Debarek and a control town, Adi Arkai, the project observed a 38% reduction in the infant mortality rate, improvements in the nutritional status of under-fives, and a decrease in the prevalence of vitamin A deficiency and goitre. The project focused on nutrition education, healthcare services, and improvements in food production and poultry keeping to address malnutrition and promote human adaptability in the region.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Anthropology
